strapiPost.title: Rogers Lion Club To Retire After 75yrs
strapiPost.content:
After 75 years, the Rogers chapter of Lions Club International will cease operations at the end of 2021. 

  • Service: The Rogers Lion Club was the 2nd ever civic club to be chartered by the city. It has provided vision and hearing services to Rogers since its inception in 1946, and throughout the years has worked closely with schools and non-profits to assist in the community. 
  • To remember: Due to a decline in membership, the club will retire but will live on in preserved history and memories. 7 decades worth of club memorabilia will be added to the Rogers Historical Museum for people to see for generations, so be on the look out for that.

Read the full story HERE.
